snippet: Senior American, Russian and United Nations diplomats could not agree on a date for peace talks, nor were they able to decide on which countries should participate.
abstract: Senior diplomats from the United States, Russia and the United Nations fail to agree on any basic details regarding long-awaited peace conference aimed at settling the Syrian conflict; acknowledge lack of consensus means talks will not take place in November and possibly not in 2013.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: Senior American, Russian and United Nations diplomats could not agree on a date for peace talks, nor were they able to decide on which countries should participate.

headline.main: Diplomats Fail to Agree on Details for Syria Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Diplomats Fail to Agree on Details for Syria Peace Talks
